decks.notes: The key concept of this deck is to quickly generate mana and storm count to cast powerful spells like Tendrils of Agony and Ad Nauseam, using cards like Dark Ritual and Lion's Eye Diamond. Burning Wish is used to search for these key cards from the sideboard in crucial moments. The deck also includes protection and disruption elements like Veil of Summer and Defense Grid to protect its combo pieces. The mana base is versatile, allowing for access to multiple colors to support the deck's spells.

This deck focuses on disrupting opponents with cards like Meddling Mage and Plague Engineer while maintaining board presence and card advantage through cards like Aether Vial, Baleful Strix, and Recruiter of the Guard. Teferi, Time Raveler provides additional disruption and protection. The deck also has flicker effects like Flickerwisp and Soulherder to abuse enter-the-battlefield triggers of creatures like Recruiter of the Guard and Barrin, Tolarian Archmage. The mana base is built to support the deck's colors and provide utility with lands like Karakas and Wasteland.

The main focus of this deck is to quickly fill up the graveyard with creatures using cards like Faithless Looting and Stitcher's Supplier, and then use those creatures to cast Hogaak, Arisen Necropolis for a powerful finish. By utilizing cards like Bloodghast and Vengevine that can easily return from the graveyard, along with the sacrifice outlets like Altar of Dementia and Carrion Feeder, this deck aims to create a large board presence and overwhelm the opponent in a fast and aggressive manner. The inclusion of Cabal Therapy also helps disrupt the opponent's game plan and protect your own combo.

The main concept of this Legacy 1 vs 1 deck is to quickly fill the graveyard with creatures using cards like Hedron Crab, Stitcher's Supplier, and Careful Study, in order to bring back powerful creatures like Hogaak, Arisen Necropolis and Vengevine. The deck focuses on utilizing the Bridge from Below to create zombie tokens and generate value when creatures are put into the graveyard. The goal is to overwhelm the opponent with a fast and efficient combo strategy centered around graveyard recursion and token generation.

The deck focuses on controlling the game by using a combination of powerful planeswalkers like Jace, the Mind Sculptor and Oko, Thief of Crowns, along with efficient removal spells like Swords to Plowshares and Abrupt Decay. It also utilizes card draw and manipulation with cards like Brainstorm and Ponder, and generates value through cards like Uro, Titan of Nature's Wrath and Ice-Fang Coatl. The mana base is designed to support the deck's heavy use of snow-covered lands and color fixing, allowing for flexibility in casting spells and ensuring a smooth gameplay experience.

The key concept of this deck is to quickly fill the graveyard with creatures using cards like Stitcher's Supplier and Altar of Dementia, then utilize the graveyard to cast Hogaak, Arisen Necropolis and Vengevine for a powerful combo finish. Additionally, cards like Bloodghast and Gravecrawler provide constant pressure on the opponent, while Cabal Therapy disrupts their strategy. Cards like Bridge from Below and Careful Study provide support for the combo strategy. The deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with aggressive creature plays and graveyard shenanigans.

The deck focuses on utilizing cards like Crop Rotation and Green Sun's Zenith to quickly assemble the combo of Dark Depths and Thespian's Stage to create a 20/20 Marit Lage token. The deck also includes cards like Mox Diamond and Elvish Reclaimer to ramp up and search for key pieces, while utilizing cards like Sylvan Safekeeper and Thalia, Guardian of Thraben to protect the combo. The mana base is focused on finding the necessary lands to assemble the combo quickly and efficiently, while also including disruptive elements like Wasteland and Karakas to disrupt the opponent's game plan.

This deck focuses on utilizing cheap and efficient spells to control the board and pressure the opponent with aggressive creatures. By utilizing cards like Delver of Secrets and Dreadhorde Arcanist to apply pressure, while also using disruptive spells like Daze and Force of Will to protect your own threats, this deck aims to create a fast clock while disrupting the opponent's game plan. The deck also includes powerful removal options like Lightning Bolt and Oko, Thief of Crowns to deal with threats and maintain board control. Additionally, the deck features a mana base with dual lands and Wasteland to ensure consistent mana development.

This deck focuses on using powerful artifact cards to quickly ramp up Mana and disrupt the opponent's strategy. By utilizing cards like Karn, the Great Creator, Chalice of the Void, and Narset, Parter of Veils, this deck aims to control the board and limit the opponent's options. Urza, Lord High Artificer and Emry, Lurker of the Loch provide additional value by allowing the player to play multiple artifacts each turn. The deck also includes powerful draw effects like Echo of Eons to maintain card advantage and keep up the pressure on the opponent.

The deck focuses on quickly getting big threats like Emrakul, the Aeons Torn or Griselbrand onto the battlefield by using cards like Show and Tell and Omniscience. The deck prioritizes cards that dig for key pieces like Ponder, Preordain, and Brainstorm, while also including protection spells like Force of Will and Veil of Summer. The deck also runs a small number of interaction spells like Daze and Cunning Wish to disrupt opponents. Overall, the deck aims to set up a powerful combo while maintaining control and flexibility through its versatile card choices.

The deck focuses on utilizing aggressive threats like Delver of Secrets, Tarmogoyf, and Hooting Mandrills to quickly pressure the opponent while disrupting their game plan with cards like Daze, Force of Will, and Wasteland. Additionally, the deck includes powerful planeswalkers like Oko, Thief of Crowns to provide additional value and disruption. The key concept of this deck is to maintain a strong balance between aggressive threats and disruptive elements to control the game and come out on top in the end.

The key strategy of this deck is to maintain control over the game by utilizing efficient removal spells and counter spells while generating card advantage through card draw effects like Sylvan Library and Brainstorm. The deck also aims to control the board with powerful planeswalkers like Jace, the Mind Sculptor and Oko, Thief of Crowns. Additionally, the deck utilizes the snow permanent synergy to enable cards like Dead of Winter and Ice-Fang Coatl, providing additional value and control over the game. Overall, the deck focuses on controlling the game until it can establish a dominant position and win.

The main concept of this Legacy 1 vs 1 Elves combo deck is to quickly ramp up mana with cards like Gaea's Cradle and Heritage Druid, while also generating card advantage through Glimpse of Nature and Elvish Visionary. Once enough mana is accumulated, the deck aims to win the game by casting a powerful creature like Craterhoof Behemoth through Natural Order. The deck also utilizes creatures with tap abilities like Wirewood Symbiote and Quirion Ranger to generate additional mana and/or untap creatures for extra value. The synergy between the various Elves in the deck allows for explosive turns and fast wins.

The main concept of this deck is to control the game by utilizing a variety of removal spells, counter magic, and powerful planeswalkers. This is achieved through cards like Force of Will, Swords to Plowshares, and Abrupt Decay to disrupt opponent's game plan while using Jace, the Mind Sculptor and Oko, Thief of Crowns to generate card advantage and control the board. The deck also includes powerful creatures like Uro, Titan of Nature's Wrath and Ice-Fang Coatl to provide additional threats and card draw. The mana base is optimized for consistency and includes efficient mana fixing with cards like Arcum's Astrolabe and fetch lands.

This deck focuses on quickly establishing board presence and applying pressure to the opponent through efficient creatures and countermagic. By utilizing cards like Delver of Secrets, Tarmogoyf, and Dreadhorde Arcanist, along with disruptive spells such as Stifle, Daze, and Force of Will, the deck aims to control the pace of the game and disrupt the opponent's strategy. The mana base enables flexibility in casting spells across all colors, while cards like Lightning Bolt and Oko, Thief of Crowns provide additional utility and removal options.

The main goal of this deck is to quickly generate a large number of mana-producing elves, allowing the player to cast powerful creatures like Craterhoof Behemoth or Archon of Valor's Reach using Natural Order. Glimpse of Nature and Green Sun's Zenith are key cards that help keep the combo going by drawing more cards and tutoring for necessary pieces. The deck focuses on explosive turns where the player can overwhelm the opponent with a massive board presence and powerful creatures, ultimately leading to a swift victory.
